intro: Kermadecia elliptica, commonly known as the Kermadec bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and maritime climates. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Kermadecia elliptica is a low-growing perennial that is often found in the Kermadec Islands and other parts of the North Island.
